subject: Medicine
title: Painkillers: From Aspirin to Opioids
description: Learn Painkillers: From Aspirin to Opioids in one minute.

hook.text: Aspirin comes from willow bark used for 3,500 years. Opioids come from poppies cultivated for just as long.

buildup.text: NSAIDs like aspirin block prostaglandins causing pain and inflammation. Opioids bind receptors that block pain signals.

discovery.text: NSAIDs work at the site of injury. Opioids work in the brainâ€”which is why they're more powerful and more addictive.

climax.text: Finding effective pain relief without addiction risk remains one of pharmacology's greatest unsolved challenges.

punchline.text: Pain relief is ancient. Safe pain relief is still evolving.

quiz.question: Why are opioids more addictive than NSAIDs?
options: Opioids act on brain receptors involved in pleasure and reward
NSAIDs are chemically identical to opioids
Opioids are plant-based while NSAIDs are synthetic
